item.title: Random Event
item.dc:creator: @podulke podulke
item.description:
@podulke wrote:

Here’s my random event system =) this is evil chicken and Strange plant.

Add these ints

public int reChance = 20; //this is how many times you get the random event in an hour period
public int reTimer = reTimeGet();

Then add these voids/other ints

public int reTimeGet() {
	return ((reChance / 20) * 240);
}

public void randomProcess() {
	int reNum = 1; //The amount of random events.
	if (!(reNum == 0)) {
		int rndID = ((int)(Math.random()*(reNum +  ((reNum - 1) + 5)))) + 1;
		switch (rndID) {
			
			//Put random event code here. Just add a case with the npc's ect..
	case 1:			spawnAttack(2468, 128);			sendMessage("EVIL CHICKEN!!!!!");
break;
	
case 2:			
spawnAttack(408, 90);			sendMessage("STRANGE PLANT!!!!!");
				break;
			default:
		}
	}
}

search boolean process and add this

reTimer--;
if (reTimer <= 0) {
	reTimer = reTimeGet();
	randomProcess();
}

If you have any questions,errors or anything pm me, ill be glad to help anyone =)

Edit: forgot some voids sorry, add these voids/ints

public void spawnAttack(int npcID, int npcHP) {
	int slot = server.npcHandler.doNPC(npcID, absX - 1, absY, heightLevel, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, npcHP);
	if (slot <= -1) { return; }
		server.npcHandler.npcs[slot].StartKilling = server.playerHandler.getPlayerID(playerName);
		server.npcHandler.npcs[slot].RandomWalk = false;
		server.npcHandler.npcs[slot].IsUnderAttack = true;
}
public int doNPC(int npcType, int x, int y, int heightLevel, int rangex1, int rangey1, int rangex2, int rangey2, int WalkingType, int HP) {
		// first, search for a free slot
		int slot = -1;
		for (int i = 1; i < maxNPCs; i++) {
			if (npcs[i] == null) {
				slot = i;
				break;
			}
		}

		if(slot == -1) return -1;		// no free slot found

		NPC newNPC = new NPC(slot, npcType);
		newNPC.absX = x;
		newNPC.absY = y;
		newNPC.makeX = x;
		newNPC.makeY = y;
		newNPC.moverangeX1 = rangex1;
		newNPC.moverangeY1 = rangey1;
		newNPC.moverangeX2 = rangex2;
		newNPC.moverangeY2 = rangey2;
		newNPC.walkingType = WalkingType;
		newNPC.HP = HP;
		newNPC.MaxHP = HP;
		newNPC.MaxHit = (int)Math.floor((HP / 10));
		if (newNPC.MaxHit < 1) {
			newNPC.MaxHit = 1;
		}
		newNPC.heightLevel = heightLevel;
		npcs[slot] = newNPC;
		return slot;
	}

Read full topic

item.title: Random Event
item.dc:creator: @xx_qwertyuiop_xx xx qwertyuiop xx
item.description:
@xx_qwertyuiop_xx wrote:

That’s correct.
And for bob the cat, just use the random(int) method in misc.java to pick a random int.
And if the int selected equals something (1, for example, out of a random amount of 4), the random could appear and teleport you. See how easy it is to think of these things? You just have to put a little time into it.

Read full topic

item.title: Random Event
item.dc:creator: @_Vengeance _Vengeance
item.description:
@_Vengeance wrote:

I do know the answer to the question, and its quite simple.

Just make a timer with a random amount of time, and when its finished counting down make an NPC appear and set the player its attacking to the person who received the random.

^ For Evil Chicken.

For Mysterious Old Man, it’s the same process, only instead of setting it to attack the player, have another 3 second or so timer, make the NPC say something and add an item to the inventory.

All of those are extremely simple things to do, and with some common sense you should be able work that out; And with Java knowledge you can apply that to your server.

Read full topic
